member.name: T:DatabaseLoader.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:DatabaseLoader.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:DatabaseLoader.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:DatabaseLoader.Properties.Resources.UnloadProcessMsSqlSourceCode
P:DatabaseLoader.Properties.Resources.UnloadProcessOracleSourceCode
M:DatabaseLoader.Shared.ILoader.Load(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function tries to bulk load the data first. If it fails, it tries the conventional load to retrieve the error information.
member.param: Connection string of the database to load the data into.
Full path of the ".dataload" file to be loaded in the database.
Whether to leave the data in the database after the process is finished running. True to not make the data stay in the database, false to automatically unload it when process terminates.

member.name: M:DatabaseLoader.Shared.ILoader.Unload(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This function unloads the data from the database.
member.remarks: If the data set contains relative dates, the data must be unloaded on the same day that it has been loaded.
member.param: Connection string of the database to load the data into.
Full path of the ".dataload" file to be loaded.

member.name: T:DatabaseLoader.Oracle.IOracleLoader
member.summary: Provides methods to load and unload in the databse the ".dataload" files. It is implemented by OracleLoader.

member.name: M:DatabaseLoader.Oracle.IOracleLoader.BulkLoad(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function defers all deferable constraints before loading the data in the database. This makes the loading much faster, but loses all error information if the loading fails.
member.remarks: The database must contain deferable constraints for BulkLoad to make a difference.
member.param: Connection string of the database to load the data into.
Full path of the ".dataload" file to be loaded.
Whether to leave the data in the database after the process is finished running. True to not make the data stay in the database, false to automatically unload it when process terminates.

member.name: M:DatabaseLoader.Oracle.IOracleLoader.ConventionalLoad(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function loads the data in the database using simple insert statements.
member.param: Connection string of the database to load the data into.
Full path of the ".dataload" file to be loaded.
Whether to leave the data in the database after the process is finished running. True to not make the data stay in the database, false to automatically unload it when process terminates.

member.name: M:DatabaseLoader.Oracle.IOracleLoader.Load(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function tries to bulk load the data first. If it fails, it tries the conventional load to retrieve the error information.
member.param: Connection string of the database to load the data into.
Full path of the ".dataload" file to be loaded in the database.
Whether to leave the data in the database after the process is finished running. True to not make the data stay in the database, false to automatically unload it when process terminates.

member.name: M:DatabaseLoader.Oracle.IOracleLoader.Unload(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This function unloads the data from the database.
member.remarks: If the data set contains relative dates, the data must be unloaded on the same day that it has been loaded.
member.param: Connection string of the database to load the data into.
Full path of the ".dataload" file to be loaded.

member.name: T:DatabaseLoader.Oracle.OracleLoader
member.summary: This class is responsible for loading and unloading from the database the ".dataload" files created with Database Editor.
